Title: Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
Do you want to use your analytical abilities to make an impact on the healthcare of others? Join CVS Health as a Care Management Analytics Data Scientist, where you will implement analytic reporting & technology as it relates to contractual analytic reporting needs, program value evaluation, issue resolution, capabilities and stabilization. Here, you will be a part of a growing, high impact team that support various care management analytic activities as an individual contributor.
Additionally, you will:
 Run reconciliation report and build stories for outcomes and delivery team. Develop outcome reporting, analytics and interactive Tableau dashboards. Evaluate program performance, identify opportunities, and uncover areas for program improvement. Use the information learned to provide recommendations and solutions to business partners. Perform analyses of structured and unstructured data to inform advanced statistical and mathematical analyses Use data visualization tools and techniques to effectively and efficiently communicate analytic findings to support business decisions and client reporting needs Explore, understand, and interpret sophisticated data environments, applying tools such as machine learning and natural language processing to analyze petabytes of data Recommend solutions to drive successful outcomes and build a data driven story of value, engage with stakeholders to obtain a true understanding of requirements to support both business decision making and client requests Utilize new technologies such as Teradata, R Markdown, Hadoop, Tableau, Snowflake, BigQuery, Google Cloud, and Alation to support reporting needs

To be successful in this role you will bring with you a demonstrated history of success utilizing oral and verbal communication skills to present information and build partnerships. You should also have a high level of attention to detail. Your problem-solving skills will be tested as you further your understanding of data reconciliation, reporting, and analysis.
Must be able to travel up to 10%. Travel may require but is not limited to flights, overnight stays, local travel, travel on short notice and other travel deemed necessary by the Company.
Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: $ 60,000
Maximum: $ 128,700
Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.
Required Qualifications
 1-2 years data science experience required 1-2 years Tableau experience. 2 plus years SQL & R experience or other relative programming experience. 2 plus years Healthcare data analytics experience.

COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.

Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.
Preferred Qualifications
 4 plus years SQL experience or other relative programming experience in the context of applications such as Tableau, Teradata, Hadoop, Snowflake, BigQuery, Google Cloud, and Alation. 4 plus years experience coding in R and R Markdown. 4 plus years experience working in a professional environment with clients/partners including Reconciliation, Program Value Evaluation, and Root Cause Analysis. 2 plus years utilizing machine learning and natural language processing tools. Masters Degree with concentration in Information Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Analytics, Epidemiology or other programming and data related fields of study preferred. Knowledge of epidemiology study design, healthcare claims data Experience in designing measurements around clinical outcome (e.g. drug adherence, utilization of medical procedures), behavioral health outcome, social determinant of health.

CVS Health is seeking a Data Scientist to join our team. As a Data Scientist, Member Retention Analytics, you will drive the next level of growth with CVS Health and Aetna with a bold new approach to total health; a national B2C healthcare brand reaching millions of prospects and members.

About the job
    


Job Description
CVS Pharmacy, Inc., a CVS Health company, is hiring for the following role in Woonsocket, RI: Data Scientist to research market conditions and implement search marketing tactics to increase visibility and engagement for the CVS ExtraCare program. Duties include: gather information for the Analytics team to plan campaigns to scale our loyalty program and optimize our customer contact strategy; analyze customer metrics, category and campaign data and develop recommendations to increase visibility to target markets using advanced analytics to optimize personalized contact strategies across multiple programs and channels; use data and analytics to drive business results; conduct hands-on analysis of customer and campaign data using analytical and statistical tools such as SQL/Python to uncover insights into customer behavior and forecast business profitability; analyze customer segments, build out customer profiles, and optimize campaigns (direct mail, email, point of sale, digital) including ad hoc and custom requests to internal business partners, and present results to leadership; collect and analyze data on customer demographics and preferences to identify growth opportunities, draw customer insights, and quantify opportunities to support business case development; leverage data and analytics to develop targeting recommendation and test plans to optimize customer programs, including audience selection, product and offer recommendation, multi-channel contact cadence, external data and partnerships; work with Data Science team to develop advanced analytics/Machine Learning models to optimize contact strategies for new and existing programs; and own the execution and delivery of multiple analytical projects including design, execution, and delivery of campaign, customer, and category/vendor analysis, present results to internal business partners and leadership.

Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Statistics, Analytics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field and six (6) months of experience in each of the following: Data analysis using SQL or SAS; Extracting and manipulating data; Customer analytics, CRM or database marketing; Retail, Financial Services, Insurance, or Telecom domains; Teradata; and Statistical modeling.
